alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 3:20PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL AND NORTHWESTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 320 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cochiti Lake, or 16 miles west of Santa Fe, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, White Rock, Eldorado At Santa Fe, La Cienega, Frijoles, La Bajada, Bandelier National Monument, Chupadero, Agua Fria and Pena Blanca. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 269 and 283. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area
